title: CompletionException every few seconds
body:
(May be related to #2578, message seems similar but not identical)

I get this message every few seconds. Client is not attesting at the moment.
```
18:20:21.144 ERROR - PLEASE FIX OR REPORT | Unexpected exception thrown for p2p-async-scheduler-0 java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException: Task tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.ScheduledExecutorAsyncRunner$$Lambda$327/0x00007f69f9bc58b0@2f63d2c0 rejected from java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor@3eba676c[Running, pool size = 10, active threads = 10, queued tasks = 5000, completed tasks = 1052560] (See log file for full stack trace)
```

Logfile is several GB, so not adding here, can provide it on request. Version: teku/v0.12.4-dev-1bbea6b0/linux-x86_64/-ubuntu-openjdk64bitservervm-java-11

Thanks for this. We've noticed it on occasion but haven't got as far as dealing with it.

Basically the queues are overflowing, so its not all bad, but the reporting could be cleaned up and we can probably stop dumping stack trace to log for it. We might end up writing a periodic warning to log so that you're aware the queue is full, but it'll substantially reduce the log congestion.

https://github.com/PegaSysEng/teku/pull/2644 will help reduce how often we get these exceptions, as will the changes to queue and consolidate checkpoint and state regeneration tasks.  Still would be good to make the exceptions a lot less noisy though.
